healthcare.text: Healthcare access in San Juan Alicante meets international standards with minimal waiting times. Quirónsalud Hospital, located 8 kilometres away, provides comprehensive private hospital services with English-speaking medical staff specializing in serving international patients. Numerous private clinics throughout the area offer routine healthcare, dental services, and specialist consultations. Pharmacies are ubiquitous, staffed by English-speaking professionals prepared to advise on over-the-counter medication. The regional hospital system provides emergency services with modern equipment. Many residents maintain private health insurance policies (typically €50-120 monthly) to access private facilities, avoiding public system queues. Healthcare costs remain significantly lower than UK NHS or US insurance while maintaining comparable quality standards.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain with minimal restrictions. UK citizens, EU residents, and international buyers face no legal barriers to ownership. The purchase process requires obtaining a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), but this is straightforward administrative procedure handled by your lawyer. Most transactions complete within 6-8 weeks. Property ownership is identical regardless of nationality—foreign ownership is commonplace in coastal regions.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs in Spain typically total 8-10% of property price beyond the purchase price itself. This comprises: 6-8% transfer tax (varying by region), 1% notary fees, 0.5% land registry fees, and legal fees of €800-1,500. Additional costs include property inspection (€300-500) and potential mortgage fees if financing. Renovation or furnishing costs depend entirely on investor preferences. Annual ownership costs include property tax (approximately 0.4% of cadastral value annually), plus utilities and insurance.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent cost of living, significantly lower than UK or Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for one person average €1,200-1,500 including rent, utilities, groceries, and dining out 2-3 times weekly. Retired couples typically budget €2,000-2,500 monthly for comfortable lifestyle. Supermarket groceries cost 30-40% less than UK equivalent. Restaurant meals average €10-15 for mains. Healthcare costs through private insurance run €50-120 monthly. Property ownership taxes are minimal compared to property values.

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca represents one of Europe's strongest property investment markets, combining rental yield potential with capital appreciation and lifestyle benefits. The region experiences +8% year-on-year growth, established tourist infrastructure generating consistent rental demand, and cosmopolitan amenities attracting international residents. Unlike speculative markets, Costa Blanca demand is underpinned by genuine migration trends, tourism economics, and infrastructure investment. Property here delivers both lifestyle enjoyment and financial returns—appealing equally to investor-operators and those seeking vacation residences.

faqs.question: How much rental income can I expect from this property?
faqs.answer: This 2-bedroom apartment typically generates €800-900 weekly from holiday lets during peak seasons (June-September), producing €3,200-3,600 monthly during these periods. Shoulder seasons (April-May, October-November) generate €500-700 weekly. Winter months (December-March) command €400-600 weekly but attract longer-stay tenants. Conservative annual occupancy estimates of 50% yield €18,000-24,000 annual gross rental income, representing 6-8% returns. Alternatively, long-term monthly rentals average €1,000-1,300, providing €12,000-15,600 annually with lower management complexity and tenant turnover.

faqs.question: Нужна ли мне виза для покупки недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: No visa is required specifically for property purchase. Most international buyers visit Spain on standard tourist visas (90 days visa-free for US, UK, Canada, Australia citizens) or obtain residence permits independently of property ownership. If you purchase property and intend establishing residency, Spanish residency permits are available through various routes including investor visas (requiring €500,000 property investment), self-sufficiency visas (demonstrating income of €2,000-2,500 monthly), or digital nomad visas. Property ownership itself grants no automatic residency status but facilitates applications.

faqs.question: What is the property management process if I don't live here?
faqs.answer: Non-resident investors typically engage professional property management companies handling all operational aspects. Property managers arrange furnishing (if holiday let), maintain listings across booking platforms (Airbnb, Booking.com, VRBO), manage guest communications and check-ins, arrange cleaning and maintenance, coordinate repairs, and remit rental income monthly. Management costs typically run 25-30% of gross rental income for holiday lets, 8-10% for long-term tenancy management. Many investors partner with specialized companies experienced in managing properties remotely for UK and international clients, with bilingual staff and professional systems.

faqs.question: How long does the purchase process take in Spain?
faqs.answer: The standard property purchase timeline spans 4-8 weeks from offer acceptance to completion. Key stages include: offer and acceptance (days 1-2), legal due diligence by your lawyer (weeks 1-2), mortgage pre-approval if financing (weeks 2-3), notary appointment scheduling (weeks 2-3), final notary signing and fund transfer (week 4-8). Delays occasionally extend timelines if mortgage approvals require extended documentation or if surveys reveal unexpected issues. Engaging an experienced English-speaking property lawyer from initial stages prevents common delays and ensures your interests are protected throughout.

faqs.question: What taxes apply to property ownership and rental income in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property owners pay annual property tax (IBI) approximately 0.4% of cadastral value—typically €200-400 annually for properties at this price level. Rental income is subject to Spanish income tax at rates ranging 20-45% depending on your tax residency status. Non-residents typically pay 20-24% on Spanish-sourced income with potential tax treaty benefits reducing obligations. Capital gains tax applies when selling (ranging 20-30% depending on holding period), though primary residences qualify for exemptions. Proper tax planning through a Spanish accountant familiar with international taxpayers typically reduces burden by 15-20% through legitimate optimization strategies.
